status.description: The HTTP-style status code of the response.

id.description: The unique account identifier for the user.

firstName.description: The first name of the account holder.

lastName.description: The last name of the account holder.

email.description: The email address associated with the account.

source.description: The source from which the account was created.

balance.description: The current balance of the user's account in USD.

lowBalanceAlerts.description: Indicates if the user has opted to receive low balance alerts.

newsletters.description: Indicates if the user has subscribed to newsletters.

promotionalEmails.description: Indicates if the user has opted to receive promotional emails.

status.description: The HTTP-style status code of the response.

code.description: A short string identifying the type of error.

param.description: The parameter related to the error, if applicable.

details.description: Optional array of additional details. Each item is an object with the field name as key and error message as value.

status.description: The HTTP-style status code of the response.

code.description: A short string identifying the error.

message.example: An unexpected error occurred on the server.
message.description: Human-readable description of the server error.

param.description: The parameter related to the error, if applicable.

details.description: Optional array of additional details. Each item is an object with the field name as key and error message as value.

status.description: The HTTP-style status code of the response.

code.description: A short string identifying the error.

message.example: Rate limit exceeded. Please try again later.
message.description: Human-readable description of the server error.

param.description: The parameter related to the error, if applicable.

details.description: Optional array of additional details. Each item is an object with the field name as key and error message as value.

get.description: Retrieve details about your MaxAI account, including your unique account ID, personal information, account balance, and communication preferences.

200.description: The account information was retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieve the API keys associated with your MaxAI account.

status.description: The HTTP-style status code of the response.

data.description: Array of API key objects associated with the account.

id.description: The unique identifier for the API key.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the user who owns the API key.

partialKey.description: The first 8 characters of the API key. The full key is only shown when created on the dashboard.

name.description: The name assigned to the API key for identification purposes.

description.description: A brief description of the API key's purpose.

expirationDate.description: The date and time when the API key will expire, or null if it does not expire.

permissions.description: Array of permissions granted to the API key.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the API key was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the API key was last updated.

delete.description: Deletes the API key used in the Authorization header. After deletion, this key will no longer be valid for making requests.

status.description: The HTTP-style status code of the response.

message.description: Confirmation message indicating the API key has been deleted.

get.description: Retrieve the usage statistics associated with your MaxAI account, including costs and requests for different time periods.

status.description: The HTTP-style status code of the response.

data.description: Object containing usage statistics for the account.

usage.description: Usage statistics broken down by time periods.

cost.description: Total cost incurred during this time period.

requests.description: Total number of requests made during this time period.
Total number of requests made today.

cost.description: Total cost incurred over the last 7 days.

requests.description: Total number of requests made over the last 7 days.

cost.description: Total cost incurred over the last 30 days.

requests.description: Total number of requests made over the last 30 days.

post.description: Submit a request for image generation. Each account can queue up to 25 concurrent requests. If the limit is exceeded, a 429 Too Many Requests error is returned.

requestId.description: Optional unique UUID v4 for the request. If not provided, a server-generated UUID will be assigned.

model.description: The model to use for image generation. Defaults to 'blackforestlabs@flux.1-schnell'.

safetyLevel.description: Level of content moderation applied to the input prompts and images. Defaults to 'medium'.

scanResults.description: If true, generated images are scanned for NSFW content.

positivePrompt.description: Text description guiding the image generation. A value of `__BLANK__` lets the AI generate an image freely, without a specific prompt, allowing it to produce random or creative content of its choice.

negativePrompt.description: Text description of elements or styles to avoid. Optional.

seedImage.description: Optional URL or base64/data URI of a seed image.

seedImageStrength.description: Influence of seed image on final output. Defaults to 0.5.

outputQuality.description: Compression quality of the output image. Defaults to 95.

outputType.description: Format returned by the API. Defaults to 'url'.

samples.description: Number of images to generate. Defaults to 1.

CFGScale.description: Controls how closely the image adheres to the prompt. Defaults to 5.

steps.description: Number of inference steps for generation. Defaults to 25.

seed.description: Random seed for reproducibility. If not provided, a random seed is generated.

scheduler.description: Scheduler used during image generation. Defaults to the model's default.

layerDiffuse.description: Enable LayerDiffuse for FLUX models. Defaults to false.

width.description: Width in pixels (multiple of 64). Defaults to 512.

height.description: Height in pixels (multiple of 64). Defaults to 512.

201.description: Image generation request successfully received and queued.

status.description: HTTP-style status code of the response.

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the submitted image generation request.

get.summary: Poll the status of an image generation request
get.description: Retrieve the current status and results of a specific image generation request. Use the `requestId` returned when submitting the generation request.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The UUID of the image generation request to check.

200.description: Image generation request status retrieved successfully.

delete.description: Cancel a specific image generation request that is still in the queued status.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The UUID of the image generation request to cancel.

204.description: The image generation request was successfully cancelled.

post.description: Submit a request for video generation. Each account can queue up to 10 concurrent requests. If the limit is exceeded, a 429 Too Many Requests error is returned.

requestId.description: Optional unique UUID v4 for the request. If not provided, a server-generated UUID will be assigned.

positivePrompt.description: Text description guiding the image generation. A value of `__BLANK__` lets the AI generate an image freely, without a specific prompt, allowing it to produce random or creative content of its choice.

frameImage.description: URL or base64/data URI of the image used as the starting point for the video.

model.description: The model to use for video generation. Defaults to 'bytedance@seedance-pro-fast'.

duration.description: Duration of the video in seconds. Must be between 3 and 12.

seed.description: Random seed for reproducibility. If not provided, a random seed is generated.

201.description: Video generation request successfully received and queued.

status.description: HTTP-style status code of the response.

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the submitted video generation request.

get.summary: Poll the status of a video generation request
get.description: Retrieve the current status and results of a specific video generation request. Use the `requestId` returned when submitting the generation request.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The UUID of the image generation request to check.

200.description: Image generation request status retrieved successfully.

delete.description: Cancel a specific video generation request that is still in the queued status.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The UUID of the video generation request to cancel.

204.description: The video generation request was successfully cancelled.
